cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west through the Florida Straits tonight, then turning WNW and NW into the east-central Gulf of Mexico; forecast to curve toward the Florida Big Bend and then up across Georgia/South Carolina late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from the Florida Keys westward to Louisiana, and later the Georgia–South Carolina coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated totals up to 6 inches possible along the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: Brief squalls with gusts to tropical-storm force are possible, but sustained TS winds are unlikely (≤5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at PortMiami.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain beginning Sunday night through Monday could produce localized flooding/flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Ponding on terminal yards and roadway flooding may disrupt port truck traffic.
